title: Yahoo Email Not Signing on Firefox
content:
All of a sudden, Yahoo email is not signing on Firefox on Windows 11. It is working on other browsers on the same computer, and even on Firefox on the Mac computer that is running the Windows 11. I tried all possible solutions but to no avail.

1) Cleared all cached data and cookies 2) Refreshed FF 3) Completely uninstalled FF and deleted the profile folder and reinstalled a fresh copy 4) Disabled all add-ons and extensions. 5) Private window

I am stuck at " Uh-oh... We can’t sign you in right now. Please try again in a while" every time I try to sign in. I get (https://login.yahoo.com/account/challenge/fail) instead of (https://login.yahoo.com/account/challenge/password).

Any suggestions?

Thank you
creator: TheBob3

title: directory structure has changed upgrading from 106.0.5 to 108.0 linux
content:
At least under linux, 'firefox' is now a directory in 108.0. For 106.0.5 and many versions prior, it was an executable.

-rw-r--r-- 1 78771445 2022-12-15 08:34 firefox-108.0.tar.bz2

tar xjvf firefox-108.0.tar.bz2

mv firefox firefox-108.0

  • -rwxr-xr-x 1 14416 2022-04-28 13:54 firefox-100.0/firefox
  • -rwxr-xr-x 1 14416 2022-08-08 07:34 firefox-103.0.2/firefox
  • -rwxr-xr-x 1 14416 2022-11-04 08:00 firefox-106.0.5/firefox
  • drwxr-xr-x 7 4096 2022-12-15 08:47 firefox-108.0/firefox

title: Excessive ping spikes every five to six seconds
content: Just recently Firefox has started to negatively affect my network connection, seemingly only after video playback has happened. Every fix to six pings the time jumps up from the normal range (less than 100ms) to 2-3,000 ms and then returns to normal. This only happens with Firefox and seems to happen mostly when/after video playback has happened but can also happen without video playback. I have started FF without addons as well as in Safe Mode and it still occurs. As soon as I close FF the ping returns to normal and network stability resumes.

title: cronologia su macchine differenti con stesso account
content:
Salve,

ho lo stesso account firefox su due computer diversi e la sicnronizzazione attivata. Tuttavia la cronologia dei mesi passati non é la stessa, a seconda che apra il browser su un computer o sull'altro e guardi nel pannello cronologia. I segnalibri sono gli stessi su entrambi i computer. L'opzione sncronizzazione della cronologia é attivaat nelle impostazioni dell'account,

grazie

title: Firefox suggesting usernames - saved logins off
content:
Firefox is suggesting usernames on multiple websites that I access regularly. However, I have the saved logins feature turned off in Firefox.

When I access Settings > Privacy & Security > Logins and Passwords - it shows all of these options turned off.

When I access Settings > Privacy & Security > Logins and Passwords > Saved Logins... - it indicates No Logins Found / No Synced Logins found.

I do have Firefox Sync turned on to sync between devices, but since it indicates "No Synced Logins" it doesn't appear this is coming from another device. I have checked multiple devices and found they all show "No Synced Logins"

Only happening in Firefox. I am not getting these suggested logins in Edge or Chrome.

Happening across all my Windows 10 and 11 devices that have Firefox sync enabled. 2 x Windows 11 Pro 22H2 (build 22621.819) 1 x Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (build 19045.2364)

Firefox 108.0 on all Windows devices, but it started before updating to 108.

I have not yet tried resetting Firefox - hoping to use that as a last resort.

Any suggestions on where else to look or what I should try?
creator: bumgarb

title: Will pinned tabs bug ever be fixed?
content:
I randomly lose my pinned tabs and previous sessions in Firefox. It is really frustrating and it is causing me to lose time and work.

Everything works fine for month or so and then suddenly all is lost. No recently closed tabs, no recently closed windows, no pinned tabs, nothing! All I can do is go to History and try to find them there. This keeps happening for years it seams and I see that there are other having the same issues reported but they are being ignored.

Is this ever going to be even considered to be a bug?

I will probably migrate to Edge since I used it on my work PC and never had this issue.
creator: zoran.petrovic.87

title: Can no longer use gestures to close new tabs set to open a blank page (firefox 108)
content:
After updating to Firefox 108, it's no longer possible to use gesture extensions on new tabs set to open "Blank page" here: Tools > Settings > Home > New Windows and Tabs > New tabs: "Blank page".

However, when manually browsing to about:blank the page still allows gestures. E.g. to close the tab, or navigate away from it.

Viewing the page source of the "Blank page", Firefox 108 does not actually open about:blank when set to "Blank page" but instead opens about:newtab.

Either about:newtab used to allow extensions to run and no longer does, or the behavior has changed so that it now opens about:newtab instead of about:blank when setting Firefox to open new tabs in "Blank page".

This breaks work flows of using a gesture to open a new tab and gestures to navigate away from it or close it.
creator: PeculiarPecan

title: sync i ON yapınca loginlerimin silinmesi
content:
SYNC komutunu ON yaptıktan sonra bütün loginlerim siliniyor. 

Aynı  hesabım diğer bilgisayarda da var onunda loginleri silindi . Bu durum 8 Aralıkda oldu .her ikisinin de sync açık. kaybolan login ve şifreleri nasıl geri kazanabilirim. yada server yardımcı olabilir mi?

Bilgiyarlarımın işletim sistemi biri win8,1 diğeri win 10

Ayrıca kendi yedeğimden daha eski tarihli bir yedek .Loginleri sync :off yaparak yükledim ve sonra sync ON yaptım yine bütün loginlerim silindi. Diğer bilgisayarımda da kendiliğinden silindi .Açar açmaz. 8 Aralıka 2022 kadar olan şifrelerimi nasıl geri kazanabilirim.

Yardımdaki her prosedürü dikkatle uyguladım. Ancak sonuç alamadım. master password sıfırlaması hiç yapmadım çünkü herşeyim kayıtlıdır. Şifreyi değiştirdim ancak aynı sonuçları aldım.

title: tema a schermo intero
content: Salve. Stavo in chiamata su Discord con un mio amico e lui mi ha mostrato come cambiava tema a suo piacimento sul suo Google Chrome. Lui sceglieva un tema, lo scaricava e questo compariva nella home page del browser in tutta la sua maestosità. Eccitato dall'idea di avere un bel tema personalizzato mi sono messo anch'io a cercare un bel tema che stesse bene a schermo intero nella mia home page, così trovo quello che mi piace, lo installo e poi noto che è visibile solo nella user interface (la parte superione dello schermo con tutte le schede aperte) incece che essere a schermo intero. Infastidito mi metto a spulciare nelle impostazioni; non avendo trovato nulla mi metto a spulciare nell'internet in cerca di una soluzione ma tutte le soluzioni che ho trovato sono o riguardanti altre cose otroppo vecchie e quindi obsolete. Perfavore ditemi che c'è un metodo per impostare un tema a schermo intero liberandosi del noioso pattern monocromatico intorno alla barra di ricerca centrale dello schermo. Personalmente non riesco a credere che voi non abbiate pensato a una cosa del genere quindi deve esserci un modo. Confido in voi...
creator: chibidile

title: Menu bar keeps reappearing / glitching at high speed
content:
Dear all,

Pretty much the same as mentioned here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1299343

The video in that link explains it.

The menu bar keeps appearing/disappearing at a high frequency, randomly - and a key press will stop the glitch for a few seconds - or when firefox is not in focus. Tried cleaning, removing, without pluggins, setting the ui.key.menuAccessKeyFocuses etc etc. Now running the Beta, still same problem. For a while I suspected iCue and Corsair Strafe keyboard - or USB settings, ports, but nothing obvious. Also weird only Firefox suffers from it in that case.

The weird thing is it can go ok for 4-5 hours but then the next day it's back again - once in this state it's unusable.

Any help would be greatly appreciated,

Best,

Alex

title: Black screen for partner on Facebook Messenger video chat
content: My partner calls me to video chat through Facebook Messenger. I can hear him but can only see a black screen. We can both hear each other. And he can see my video. This has been happening for at least a week. There was no help in the community. There were other people that had this problem but it was never answered and archived. I tried it on Chrome browser and the problem disappeared. I downloaded FB Messenger app for Windows and that seems to work.

title: clearing all website data for a particular website
content:
fedex.com has broken my browser!

I have a FedEx account for my business, but I no longer use it. However, I also receive packages from FedEx from time to time. For reasons that cannot be explained by anyone at FedEx, my Firefox browser will not allow me to create a new FedEx account to manage my deliveries. In other words, after I enter my new username & password, the FedEx website comes back with a failure message with words to the effect that, "This didn't work, please refresh your page."

I called FedEx tech support & learned they are now totally incompetent. The only solution that was offered was "Clear all of your browser history". I didn't fall for that - I did however delete all history with "fedex" in the link. I also removed all 31 cookies associated with fedex.com. Then, I re-started the browser, and tried again:

Upon summoning the fedex.com login page, the login information was pre-filled with the userid & password for my old, unused business account! How does this happen without cookies or history? Where is fedex.com getting this data? Is it stored on my browser - or does fedex.com have some nefarious scheme whereby they're using my computer id or IP or???

I need to delete every shred of data in my browser that is associated with FedEx - how do I do this?

title: Browser crashes and pages not opening
content: About 6 weeks or so ago, I began finding messages intermittently on my screen when I got up in the morning. It would state that Firefox had crashed and needed to be restarted or closed. It would transmit error information first in either case. Firefox has sent updates a few times since, and if I had the browser closed it would update upon being opened. The original problem is still there and now I have an additional problem. The first problem was a nuisance but the second is not acceptable. My email service is fastmail which I have used for many years. Sometimes I will open an email and need to click to go to another location. My problem is that I will click to do so and I get left with a blank screen and I never arrive where i am trying to go. It never reports any kind of an error. If I use Microsoft Edge everything executes as it should. That tells me there is no problem with the emails. the email provider, and takes the problem back to Firefox. When you sent an update you may have reset my settings. It seems like it sees opening the new page I am going to is likened to blocking a popup window. I am going to guess it is treating every page I attempt to open via the page I am on like a popup window. This problem is somewhat inconsistent. Sometimes it executes just fine. I get 80 to 100 emails each day and this feature not working properly is very aggravating. Example: I open a Kohls ad email or a Sam's Club ad email and click on the object I am interested in. However, all I get is a blank page and no errors reported. It may or may not execute properly if I go directly to the retailer and not through the email service. Yet it works fine if I use Microsoft Edge for the same procedure in the same email or even if I go to the retailer's webpage directly rather than through an email. Same results, Edge works fine, Firefox doesn't work. Help me out here please.
creator: Hotwheels65

title: Spam log in
